newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish public television in deal with Warner Bros.
newsitem.headline: Polish public television in deal with Warner Bros.

text.p: Polish state-owned television Telewizja Polska SA has signed an agreement with Warner Bros giving it an option to buy and broadcast the U.S. firm's new films in Poland, the television's deputy president said.

"We have signed an agreement with Warner Bros, which guarantees an option to buy new films from Warner's offer and the right to be the sole distributors of some other films," Janusz Daszczynski told a news conference on Tuesday. @

The television's president, Ryszard Miazek, said his company's net profit increased to 155.4 million zlotys last year from 46.2 million in 1995. The firm's revenues increased to 1.21 billion zlotys from 940 million zlotys.

But Daszczynski said public television, the sole broadcaster before the 1989 fall of communism, had been losing viewers to private television. He did not give details. -- Warsaw Newsroom +48 22 653 9700
